sourceApplicationName.title: Source Application Name
sourceApplicationName.description: The official name of the application or system that will be sending files through the File Transfer Service
sourceApplicationName.requirements: Use the formal system name as known in your organization for the source system

targetApplicationName.title: Target Application Name
targetApplicationName.description: The official name of the application or system that will be receiving files through the File Transfer Service
targetApplicationName.requirements: Use the formal system name as known in your organization for the target system

isUsingIODS.title: Is using IODS?
isUsingIODS.description: Whether your current system uses the legacy IODS (Input/Output Data System) for file transfers that will be migrated to the File Transfer Service
isUsingIODS.requirements: Select Yes if you currently use IODS and need to migrate, No if you don't or are setting up a new transfer flow

iodsDetails.title: IODS Details
iodsDetails.description: Details about your existing IODS configuration that will be migrated to the File Transfer Service (only if using IODS)

oldIodsId.title: Old IODS ID
oldIodsId.description: The unique identifier for your current IODS system that will be replaced by the File Transfer Service
oldIodsId.requirements: Enter the exact ID as it appears in your IODS configuration for migration reference

onSiteServerNames.title: On Site Server Application Names
onSiteServerNames.description: Names of the on-premises servers or applications currently involved in IODS transfers
onSiteServerNames.requirements: List all relevant server names, separated by commas if multiple, for migration planning

fileName.title: File Name
fileName.description: The typical file name pattern or specific file names used in current IODS transfers
fileName.requirements: Include file extensions and any naming patterns to maintain consistency in the File Transfer Service

fileType.title: File Type
fileType.description: The format or type of files being transferred through IODS that will continue through the File Transfer Service
fileType.requirements: Specify the file format and any special characteristics for proper handling

iodsMailbox.title: IODS Mailbox or Drop Location Name
iodsMailbox.description: The mailbox or designated drop location name in the current IODS system
iodsMailbox.requirements: Use the exact name as configured in IODS for migration reference

prePostTransferProcesses.title: Pre/Post Transfer Processes
prePostTransferProcesses.description: Any automated processes that run before or after IODS file transfers that may need to be recreated in the File Transfer Service
prePostTransferProcesses.requirements: Describe any validation, encryption, or notification processes for migration consideration

systemName.title: System Name
systemName.description: A clear, descriptive name that identifies your application system for the File Transfer Service flow
systemName.requirements: Use a name that will be easily recognizable to stakeholders and will appear in File Transfer Service monitoring

internalOrExternal.title: Internal or External Application
internalOrExternal.description: Whether the application is developed and maintained internally or by an external vendor for File Transfer Service access control
internalOrExternal.requirements: Select Internal for in-house systems, External for vendor/third-party systems to determine appropriate security measures

supportedProtocols.title: Supported Protocols
supportedProtocols.description: The communication protocols your system can use for data transfer through the File Transfer Service
supportedProtocols.requirements: List all protocols the system supports from: SFTP, FTP, API, Shared Directory, AWS S3, Azure Blob Storage

platform.title: System Platform
platform.description: The underlying technology platform or infrastructure on which your system runs for File Transfer Service connectivity planning
platform.requirements: Specify the operating system, cloud platform, or technology stack for proper integration setup

environments.title: Environments In Scope
environments.description: The environments where this File Transfer Service onboarding will be implemented
environments.requirements: Select all environments that will be part of this File Transfer Service integration for proper setup

primaryRegion.title: Primary Region
primaryRegion.description: The primary geographical region where your system operates for File Transfer Service routing
primaryRegion.requirements: Choose the region where most of your system's processing occurs for optimal transfer performance

backupRegion.title: Backup Region
backupRegion.description: The backup or disaster recovery region for your system for File Transfer Service failover planning
backupRegion.requirements: Select None if no backup region is configured, otherwise choose the backup region for redundancy

networkCloudInfo.title: Section 3: Network Boundary and Cloud Boundary

networkLocation.title: Network Location
networkLocation.description: Whether your system is hosted on-premises or in the cloud for File Transfer Service connectivity configuration
networkLocation.requirements: Select On Site for on-premises hosting, Cloud for cloud-hosted systems to determine network access requirements

cloudDetails.title: Cloud Details
cloudDetails.description: Specific details about your cloud hosting configuration for File Transfer Service integration (required if Cloud is selected)

awsAccountName.title: AWS Cloud Account Name
awsAccountName.description: The friendly name of your AWS account for File Transfer Service S3 integration
awsAccountName.requirements: Use the account name as it appears in AWS Organizations or your billing for proper S3 bucket access

awsAccountNumber.title: AWS Cloud Account Number
awsAccountNumber.description: The 12-digit AWS account number for File Transfer Service S3 and API access configuration
awsAccountNumber.requirements: Enter the exact 12-digit number without spaces or dashes for IAM role and S3 bucket permissions

cloudRegion.title: Cloud Region Name
cloudRegion.description: The AWS region where your resources are deployed for File Transfer Service regional optimization
cloudRegion.requirements: Use the full region name as it appears in AWS for proper S3 bucket region configuration

awsCloudId.title: AWS Cloud ID
awsCloudId.description: Any specific cloud identifier or resource ID for your deployment for File Transfer Service resource identification
awsCloudId.requirements: Provide the specific identifier if you have one assigned for proper resource tagging

serverName.title: Server Name
serverName.description: The name or identifier of your cloud server or compute resource for File Transfer Service endpoint configuration
serverName.requirements: Use the instance name as it appears in your cloud console for proper SFTP or API endpoint setup

ipOrSubnet.title: IP or Subnet
ipOrSubnet.description: The IP address or subnet range for your cloud resources for File Transfer Service firewall and security group configuration
ipOrSubnet.requirements: Provide either specific IP or CIDR notation for subnet to configure proper access controls
ipOrSubnet.validation: Must be valid IP address or CIDR notation

applicationTarget.title: Application Target
applicationTarget.description: The specific application endpoint or target for File Transfer Service connections
applicationTarget.requirements: Provide the URL, hostname, or connection string for the application that will integrate with File Transfer Service

requiresExternalVendorConnection.title: Requires External Vendor Connection?
requiresExternalVendorConnection.description: Whether this system needs to connect to external vendor systems or third-party services through the File Transfer Service
requiresExternalVendorConnection.requirements: Select Yes if file transfers to/from external vendors are required, affecting security and compliance requirements

hasOutbound.title: Outbound Request (Cloud to On Site)?
hasOutbound.description: Whether files need to be transferred FROM the cloud TO on-premises systems using the File Transfer Service
hasOutbound.requirements: Select Yes if you need to send files from cloud to on-site through the File Transfer Service

sourceAwsAccount.title: Source AWS Account
sourceAwsAccount.description: The AWS account that will be the source for outbound transfers through the File Transfer Service
sourceAwsAccount.requirements: Enter the account number or name for the source account that will send files via the File Transfer Service

sourceBucketArn.title: Source Bucket ARN
sourceBucketArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the S3 bucket used as the source for File Transfer Service outbound transfers
sourceBucketArn.requirements: Provide the complete ARN starting with arn:aws:s3::: for File Transfer Service S3 integration
sourceBucketArn.validation: Must be valid S3 bucket ARN format

sourceArchiveBucket.title: Source Archive Bucket
sourceArchiveBucket.description: The S3 bucket name where source files are archived after successful transfer by the File Transfer Service
sourceArchiveBucket.requirements: Enter the bucket name used for archiving transferred files as per File Transfer Service retention policies

sourceArchivePrefix.title: Source Archive Prefix
sourceArchivePrefix.description: The folder path or prefix used in the archive bucket for organizing files processed by the File Transfer Service
sourceArchivePrefix.requirements: Specify the prefix structure for archived files to maintain File Transfer Service organization standards

hasInbound.title: Inbound Request (On Site to Cloud)?
hasInbound.description: Whether files need to be transferred FROM on-premises TO the cloud using the File Transfer Service
hasInbound.requirements: Select Yes if you need to send files from on-site to cloud through the File Transfer Service

targetBucket.title: Target Bucket
targetBucket.description: The S3 bucket name that will receive inbound files from on-premises via the File Transfer Service
targetBucket.requirements: Enter the destination bucket name for incoming files processed by the File Transfer Service

targetPrefix.title: Target Prefix
targetPrefix.description: The folder path or prefix in the target bucket where files will be stored by the File Transfer Service
targetPrefix.requirements: Specify the folder structure for incoming files to maintain File Transfer Service organization standards

customerEnvironments.title: Customer Environments In Scope
customerEnvironments.description: Detailed description of the customer environments that will be included in this File Transfer Service onboarding
customerEnvironments.requirements: Describe all environments, their purposes, and any special considerations for File Transfer Service implementation
examples: Development for testing File Transfer Service flows, QA for validation, Production for live operations
Single production environment with blue-green deployment for File Transfer Service

cloudEnvironmentMapping.title: Cloud Environment Mapping
cloudEnvironmentMapping.description: How your customer environments map to File Transfer Service cloud environments for proper flow configuration

development.title: DEV maps to
development.description: Which File Transfer Service cloud environment your development environment maps to
development.requirements: Select the File Transfer Service cloud environment that corresponds to your development setup

qualityAssurance.title: QA maps to
qualityAssurance.description: Which File Transfer Service cloud environment your quality assurance/testing environment maps to
qualityAssurance.requirements: Select the File Transfer Service cloud environment used for testing and validation

production.title: PROD maps to
production.description: Which File Transfer Service cloud environment your production environment maps to
production.requirements: Select the File Transfer Service cloud environment for live production workloads

implementationDeadline.title: Implementation Deadline
implementationDeadline.description: The target date when this File Transfer Service onboarding implementation should be completed and operational
implementationDeadline.requirements: Select a realistic date considering File Transfer Service setup, testing, and deployment time. Allow adequate time for security reviews and testing.
implementationDeadline.validation: Must be a future date in YYYY-MM-DD format

contacts.title: Contact Information
contacts.description: Key contacts for business and technical coordination during File Transfer Service implementation

businessContactSource.title: Business Contact (Source)
businessContactSource.description: Primary business contact for the source system or organization for File Transfer Service coordination
businessContactSource.requirements: Provide name and email of the business owner or project manager responsible for the source system

technicalContactSource.title: Technical Contact (Source)
technicalContactSource.description: Primary technical contact for the source system during File Transfer Service implementation
technicalContactSource.requirements: Provide name and email of the technical lead or architect who will handle File Transfer Service integration

businessContactTarget.title: Business Contact (Target)
businessContactTarget.description: Primary business contact for the target system or organization for File Transfer Service coordination
businessContactTarget.requirements: Provide name and email of the business owner for the receiving system in the File Transfer Service flow

technicalContactTarget.title: Technical Contact (Target)
technicalContactTarget.description: Primary technical contact for the target system during File Transfer Service implementation
technicalContactTarget.requirements: Provide name and email of the technical lead for the receiving system who will handle File Transfer Service integration

vendorContact.title: Vendor Contact (if External)
vendorContact.description: Contact information for external vendor if using third-party systems in the File Transfer Service flow
vendorContact.requirements: Required only for external applications - provide vendor representative details who can assist with File Transfer Service integration
examples: For File Transfer Service support: admin@fts.com or 222-345-1234
